etymologies: Middle English: from Old French fornais(e), from Latin fornax, fornac-, from fornus ‘oven’

definitions: an enclosed structure in which material can be heated to very high temperatures, e.g. for smelting metals.
shortDefinitions: enclosed structure in which material can be heated to very high temperatures

definitions: an appliance fired by gas, oil, or wood in which air or water is heated to be circulated throughout a building in a heating system.
shortDefinitions: appliance fn which air or water is heated to be circulated in heating system

definitions: used to describe a very hot place
